article.title: Gigamachine: incremental machine learning on desktop computers

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the variable \'tq\' represent in the LSEARCH algorithm?
choices: The total time allocated for program execution in an iteration.
The minimum time allocated for running a candidate program.
The maximum time allocated for running a candidate program.
The time quantum used to update production probabilities.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of using exponential smoothing in updating production probabilities?
choices: To ensure that all production probabilities remain non-zero.
To prevent drastic changes in probabilities when new solutions are added.
To normalize the probabilities of all productions for a given non-terminal.
To prioritize the exploration of less frequently used productions.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main advantage of incorporating previous solutions directly into the Scheme interpreter\'s library?
choices: It reduces the complexity of the grammar used for program generation.
It eliminates the need for storing and parsing previous solutions during subsequent searches.
It allows the system to directly learn and reuse programming idioms.
It improves the accuracy of the probability estimates for individual productions.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the goal of implementing frequent sub-program mining as a stochastic CFG update mechanism?
choices: To identify and eliminate redundant sub-programs from the solution corpus.
To automatically refactor the generated programs to improve their readability.
To enable the system to learn and utilize common programming patterns and idioms.
To dynamically adjust the size and complexity of the grammar used for program generation.
